content: ***this crochet pattern is available for free on my website visit pattern website link above or you can download it here on ravelry as a print-optimized ad-free pdf *** **difficulty ** advanced **materials needed ** 260 yards yarn bee yarntopia in white or color of your choice 3 25mm d hook or hook needed to obtain gauge yarn needle scissors these are like the ones in the pictures stitch markers **stitches used ** chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet **additional terms ** *3dc cluster * yo insert hook into stitch pull up a loop yo draw through 2 loops 1st stitch of cluster made yo insert hook into same st pull up a loop yo draw through 2 loops 2nd st of cluster made yo insert hook into same st pull up a loop yo draw through 2 loops 3rd st of cluster made yo draw through all loops on hook *single_crochet 2 together decrease invisible decrease * insert hook through front loop of next 2 sts yo pull up a loop yo pull through 2 *elizabeth stitch * insert hook into st yo draw up a loop yo insert hook into same st draw up a loop yo pull through all 4 loops on hook these stitches should be as tall as a single_crochet stitch *back bar of single_crochet * look at the back of the stitch and locate the short bar that runs horizontal work all designated stitches for the round into this bar this is a different location than the back loop *small puff * yo insert hook into stitch pull up a loop yo insert hook into same stitch pull up a loop 2 more times yo and pull through all 7 loops *center single_crochet center single_crochet * insert hook through center of designated st yo and draw up a loop complete as you would a regular single_crochet blo = back loop only prev = previous st/sts = stitch/stitches space/sps = space/spaces **gauge ** circle should measure 5 1/4 across after round 15 **measurements ** adult 10 wide by 8 1/2 tall preemie/newborn 6 wide by approximately 4 1/2 tall **additional notes ** -chain 1 at beginning of round does not count as a stitch -unless otherwise indicated slip stitches are not counted as a stitch and are not worked into -unless otherwise indicated round begins in same stitch as join *see pattern for additional notes*
